attributes.action: Replace Tube Drivers with Automated Technology
attributes.additional_details:
Each strike costs the economy 300 million pounds.

Starting salary of a tube driver is £49,673. 

Implementing a glass wall or barrier for each platform would cost £10-15 million pounds. This would prevent drivers from needing to monitor doors and remove any chance of track related accidents.

Modern technology can implement signalling without affecting sub-surface lines which consist of complex arrangements.

The Victoria line currently has automated technology in place showing it can be done.
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned, believe that tube drivers should be replaced with 
automated train-driving technology.

rejection.details:
The London Underground system is operated by Transport for London, which is the responsibility of the Mayor of London, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You may wish to submit a petition to the London Assembly calling for a response from the Mayor of London. Details of how to do this are available here:
https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
